title: Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Dining Saloon", May 15, 1935
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
inscribed: Inscribed in stamp, lower right: JOB # 530/ 3/8" and 1/2"-1'0"/ CENTAUR, Olsson/ 5/15/35; inscribed at lower center in graphite: DINING SALOON - SCALE FOR PLAN 3/8" -1'0- / SCALE FOR ELEVATION 1/2"-1'0; dimensions and instructions in graphite
description: Plan and elevations for dining saloon of Lady Esther Yacht. Irregular sized room with rounded corners on right, squared corners on left. Dining table with rounded right side extends from center of wall at left; reflector at center of table and surrounded by six upholstered armchairs. Painting of centaur above table on center of west wall; door on each side of west wall. Radiator on north wall with four windows with venetian blinds. Sideboard in rounded corner of east wall; three smal windows above with venetian blinds. Sideboard has two cabinets at left and right, and three stacked drawers at center. Radiator at center of south wall and four windows with venetian blinds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Dining Saloon", May 15, 1935.
May 15, 1935. Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-429.
